results.title: The Story of English. Parts 5-9
results.brief_description: Prog 5 - Pioneers! O Pioneers; Prog 6 - Black on White; Prog 7 - The Muvver Tongue; Prog 89 - The Loaded Weapon; Prog 9 - The Empire Strikes Back. A Nine part series that tells the story of English as a spoken language: how it started and survived, spread and developed. “The Story of English” spans more than 1,000 years of world history and visits locations on five continents. It presents a picture of the English speaking world and English speaking peoples of many nationalities and backgrounds.

results.title: The Story of English furniture. Part 2
results.brief_description: Arthur Negus and Hugh Scully tell the fascinating story of English furniture from the late 18th century to the present day. They demonstrate the all-important points of design and detail which make it easier to date furniture, and to tell the difference between the original and the fake or copy. Part 2 of this two part program consists of 3 segments: Robert Adam; Elegance and Unity; Victorian.

results.title: The Story of English furniture. Part 1
results.creator_credit: Robin Drake, Paul Smith and BBC
results.brief_description: Arthur Negus and Hugh Scully tell the fascinating story of English furniture from its very beginnings to the 18th century. They demonstrate the all-important points of design and detail which make it easier to date furniture and to tell the difference between the original and the fake or copy. Part one of this two part program consists of 4 segments: Medieval and Elizabethan; Jacobean and Restoration; William and Mary; Queen Anne and Early Georgian.

results.title: The Story of Elizabeth Hayward
results.brief_description:
After stealing seven shilling’s worth of silk, Elizabeth Hayward gets sent to Australia in chains. She recounts, in a letter to her parents, her horrific journey and experience of malnutrition and violent treatment of convicts by white colonials and of her desire to be back home with her parents.

An animated short entered to “Create a Stamp Story” section of ACMI’s ‘Screen It’ media making competition for Primary Schools.

results.title: The Story of EC
results.creator_credit: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children's Television Foundation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Lift off”.
Four stories that tell how EC came to live with Nipper Poss and Kim. “A Load of old rubbish”: A scruffy old doll called EC falls off a dump truck and is rescued and cleaned by Poss and Kim. “Out of order”: Nipper loses EC in the rain and EC disappears down the drain. “Clash”: Poss and Kim argue over EC’s role in a game and pull the doll apart. “Destroy”: Nipper thinks he is too old for dolls and tries to reject EC.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Patricia Edgar and Australian Children’s Television Foundation

results.title: The Story of diplomacy
results.creator_credit: Ian Dunlop, John Martin-Jones and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: Traces the history of diplomacy from the days of early Greek and Egyptian civilization. The establishment of resident ambassadors abroad, the introduction of congresses and the “balance of power”, the revolt against secrecy after World War I, resulting in the League of Nations and later the United Nations. Emphasises the continuing importance of individual negotiations. Narrated by Alastair Duncan.

results.title: The Story of cricket in Australia (Captioned)
results.brief_description: From the time of the first test, through days of aboriginal teams visiting England, the drama of the bodyline series, and the 1977 World Cricket Series Revolution, Australians have always been ‘cricket mad’. Jack Egan brings together cricket greats to recall highlights of their career, as well as using magnificent archival footage. Special appearances by Ian Chappell, Bill O’Reilly and Ray Lindwall.

results.title: The Story of Cinderella
results.brief_description: Cinderella, as seen and interpreted in watercolour and crayon drawings by fifth-grade school children. Given a free hand, the children have developed the story with charming naivety. Wicked stepmother, ugly stepsisters, fairy godmother and handsome prince - all are there. Narration and character voices also performed by the children.

results.title: The Story of Christmas
results.brief_description: The familiar story, told this time with the glowing, cameo-like zinc cut-outs of film animator Evelyn Lambart. Here the traditional cast might have been clipped from a joyful medieval manuscript, but it is embellished by the artist’s own whimsy - heraldic trumpet sounds, luminescent light, and wildflowers in every scene telling their message of rebirth. Film without words. (Award: New York.)
